snippet: Rail lines now move more than a million barrels of oil a day, causing major delays for Amtrak trains and holding up the transport of vital consumer and industrial goods.
abstract: Energy boom that has American rail lines transporting more than a million barrels of oil a day is creating sharp increase in rail freight traffic nationwide; congestion is causing major delays for Amtrak passenger trains and holding up transport of vital consumer and industrial goods.
lead_paragraph: Rail lines now move more than a million barrels of oil a day, causing major delays for Amtrak trains and holding up the transport of vital consumer and industrial goods.

headline.main: As Trains Move Oil Bonanza, Delays Mount for Other Goods and Passengers
headline.print_headline: As Trains Move Oil Bonanza, Delays Mount for Other Goods and Passengers
